intro: Rauvolfia degeneri, commonly known as the Indian snakeroot, is a climbing shrub native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by elongated, fleshy fruits containing kidney-shaped seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
